(continued) I know that as this sad news reaches everyone in American Samoa that our people will be praying, and we send New Zealand our love.

(continued) I‚Äôve met with many of our wonderful community of Samoan friends living there. New Zealand is such a welcoming, beautiful place. Just days ago, I was speaking with their Ambassador to the U.S. about all our countries share...

Congress is working to keep promises to our Veterans and those serving in our Armed Forces, including actively reforming the VA to serve individual needs better and raising pay levels for our troops https://t.co/yEZ72TxeY0

On this day in 1782, General George Washington created the Purple Heart Medal to specially recognize only those who were wounded or killed in the service of our country. The nation has honored these heroes this way since... This day and every day is a good day to thank a veteran!

Today is Purple Heart Day, honoring those throughout US history who were wounded or killed in the line of duty. Each one of them made this sacrifice in the worthy cause of freedom. https://t.co/5CNlGtMwDZ

It was incredibly moving to observe these military honors. These soldiers sacrificed their lives in their youth or prime of life in service to our country and the cause of freedom, and we owe them a great debt.

This was a solemn occasion, but it is a welcome development that these soldiers are at last going home to families and descendants. Praying these repatriated remains will bring healing to these families, and be an important and lasting reminder of the sacrifice so many have made.

I was blessed to attend the moving military Honor Carry Ceremony at Hickam led by Vice President Pence and Admiral Davidson, and with Korea veterans there to receive back the honored remains of our fallen heroes repatriated from Korea after all this time
https://t.co/hGTzeEAP22 https://t.co/EvPXW58dtk
